item.title: Register for SUT
item.note:
http://d02ntcl02.ibm.com/Default?ReturnUrl=Content%2fView%2f6ff3a2f8-cdb3-4318-995b-a5236f0ead73%2fsametime_unified_telephony_sut_-_overview_draft
From http://d02ntcl02.ibm.com/Content/View/19f4fb93-0a82-447c-aa34-ff392ab7f320/psametime_unified_telephony_sut_-_prsentation :
Europe : À l'heure actuelle, nous n'ajoutons de nouveaux utilisateurs aux installations européennes Sametime Unified Telephony (SUT) que lorsque tous les utilisateurs des pilotes SUT sont migrés des systèmes SUT d'Europe vers ceux des Etats-Unis. Cela devrait être effectué en mai. Au cas par cas, nous allons également ajouter les premiers utilisateurs au cours du processus de migration. Mais cela doit être vérifié individuellement et dépend principalement de l'infrastructure vocale des pays. Si vous souhaitez faire partie des premiers utilisateurs et être parmi les utilisateurs cible, envoyez un message à l'id de tâche suivant : Europe SUT Project/Germany/IBM@IBMDE.

item.title: Do something to avoid people forgetting to up-merge
item.note: Philip Starhill <pstarhill@us.ibm.com> wrote on 2011-08-06 00:11:44: > > Wei Wei wrote: > > > > > There are some changes by me on chimera that I did > > > not merge yet because they were blocked by previous > > > unmerged changes. > > > > Is there any way we could have an automatic check, say in a git hook, > > that forces up-merge or ignoring? For example, I think we already have > > this: if your RTC item is not right, you can't push. Likewise, if you > > have some changes in chimera and you don't up-merge(or ignore them) in > > master, then you can't push. > > > > I constantly forget to up-merge, and I believe other people have the > > same issue as well. Does this procedure sound appealing? > > Given that we've had a policy of upmerging for about 18 months, and > the frequency with which people forget to upmerge doesn't seem to be > going down, I think this is a sensible idea. I should be > possible to check if the 'git cherry dest-branch src-branch ...' > command returns a non-empty string to see if the pusher forgot something.

item.title: Configure all the unix machines at once wrt bash and ssh
item.note: Daniel Junglas/Germany/IBM wrote on 2011-06-22 14:24:10: > > Xavier Nodet, on 2011-06-22 14:23 > > > Do you have some mechanism to avoid configuring each Unix machine > > separately? Links from /home/nodet/.cshrc to /ilog/home/nodet/.cshrc? > > That is exactly what we do, at least Tobias and me. > I also keep a version of .ssh/authorized_keys in /ilog/home/djunglas so > that I can easily copy that to other machines. I never tried whether > a symlink from $HOME/.ssh/authorized_keys to /ilog/home/ works.

item.note:
Justin sent a link: https://w3-01.sso.ibm.com/software/support/trial/earlyprograms/suppt/helpdoc/playbook/mp/legal.html But this requires as much work as a release...
We could do a fix-pack for only a specific customer. See Véro or Faisal. One thing though is that we're supposed to treat all of our customers equally, and not give to one something that others can't use...
Waiting for Ed to tell me that tests are ok, and launch a Linux-x86-64 build.

item.title: Upgrade everywhere to Java 6?
item.note:
From Laci on 2011-09-26 03:33: Xavier, which java do we need? 5.0 or 6.0? In SVL we have only the 64-bit java installed, and there we use 5.0. In Hursley, where we do the builds, we use 5.0 for 64-bit builds and 6.0 for 32-bit builds. For now I replicated the same in SVL, but we should make up our minds... Perhaps after this release we should upgrade all java to the latest release of the 6.0 series? Or is there some sort of commitment to 5.0?
Moved to RTC-9241

item.title: Demander à Richard les coordonnées de Ph. Catala
Get 'local' Win32 VMs
item.note:
The VM should include - An I: drive mapped to a given path on the host OS (probably I:) - An H: drive mapped to a given path on the host OS (the user's 'home' directory) - Matlab (installed, no license) - MSF - ICC (it has a shared license, so should be ok) - Could use msys instead of (or in addition to) Cygwin
There is an automated system for this which Support set up with the old ILOG guys 21:40:16: Mary Fenelon: It works exactly like that 21:40:47: Mary Fenelon: I don't know if that has been embraced by the SVL guys or who 'owns' it 21:40:58: Mary Fenelon: It might be with the Websphere/BRMS guys 21:41:07: Mary Fenelon: but it is pretty darn slick 21:41:27: xavier.nodet@fr.ibm.com - Xavier Nodet/France/Contr/IBM: Who should I talk to about that? 21:41:39: Mary Fenelon: start with Vero 21:41:48: Mary Fenelon: but she is only a user 21:41:55: xavier.nodet@fr.ibm.com - Xavier Nodet/France/Contr/IBM: Ok. Thanks. 21:41:59: Mary Fenelon: Scott Rux seems to be the ILOG Opti support guy 21:42:04: Mary Fenelon: who takes care of their machines 21:42:27: Mary Fenelon: otherwise, Yves Le Bras is the BRMS support team mgr

item.title: Create new post to CPLEX webinars
item.note:
http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/thread.jspa?threadID=379032&tstart=0
Go to the main CPLEX forum page, http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/forum.jspa?forumID=2059 Click on "Upcoming web events" Note the URL contains the thread number, 379032. Go to (in another web browser tab, as I like to do) https://www.ibm.com/developerworks/forums/admin/login.jsp?url=forum-content.jsp%3Fforum%3D2059 Log in with username ilog_opt_admin and password "passw0rd". In the "Jump to thread" field enter 379032 and then click Go Click "Edit Thread Properties" For "isStickyThread" click "Delete" on the right. (I leave "jive.locked", which is a property meaning no one may post a reply, which I think is prudent for all announcements) Go back to the main CPLEX forum page mentioned in step 1, and click refresh on your browser, and the "Upcoming web events" is no longer found at the top.

item.title: Look at commit 130b38867f068621a095836e4a3d97b2c12058cf
item.note:
On branch master:
commit 130b38867f068621a095836e4a3d97b2c12058cf Author: Daniel Junglas Date: Mon Jan 30 16:11:53 2012 +0100 [ RTC-6294 ] Explicitly test against NULL to void warnings. A statement like 'if (&ptr)' may trigger warnings the address of ‘ptr’ will always evaluate as ‘true’ To avoid such warnings explicitly test 'if ( &ptr != NULL )' which avoids the warning. Note that we are in a macro here so it is not always obvious that we are using the address of a local variable.

item.title: Come back to Sonia Cafieri
item.note:
Sonia Cafieri <sonia@recherche.enac.fr> wrote on 2012-06-17 00:13:05:
> From: Sonia Cafieri <sonia@recherche.enac.fr> > To: Xavier Nodet/France/IBM@IBMFR, > Cc: Sonia Cafieri <sonia@recherche.enac.fr> > Date: 2012-06-17 00:13 > Subject: problemes resolus par Cplex -- suite discussion Roadef > > Bonjour Xavier, > > suite a notre (malheureusement très rapide) discussion à Angers à > l'occasion du Congrès ROADEF 2012, je transmets un exemple de > problème que j'ai résolu par CPLEX. > Désolée d'avoir pris autant de temps a donner suite a notre > discussion, j’espère que l’intérêt vers les problèmes d'optimisation > que j'essaie de résoudre soit toujours présent. > > Dans mon activité de recherche j'ai souvent a résoudre des problèmes > non-linéaires non-convexes, ou malheureusement je ne peut pas > utiliser CPLEX. J'ai pourtant pas mal utilisé CPLEX récemment dans > le contexte de développement d'algorithmes de clustering dans des > réseaux. J'ai notamment développé une heuristique de type > hiérarchique divisive ou j'ai besoin de résoudre a chaque étape un > problème quadratique mixed-integer. J'utilise donc CPLEX a chaque > étape pour résoudre un tel problème. > (ma présentation au congres Roadef été dans le cadre de cette ligne > de recherche, ainsi que la présentation d'un thésard du LIX qui > actuellement collabore a cette recherche). > Le modèle en pièce jointe correspond a un problème qu'on trouve dans > la literature de clustering dans les réseaux (dans le cas de mon > algorithme, c'est le problème résolu a la première étape). J’espère > que le format .nl soit bon (normalement j'utilise AMPL et j'ai > généré le modèle .nl par le commande 'write'). J'en peux générer des autres. > Je signale que récemment on a trouvé que les options suivantes sont > particulièrement avantageuses pour les résolutions qui nous > intéressent (CPLEX 12): > option cplex_options "threads=1 timing=1 varsel=4 cutpass=-1 > mipdisplay=4 nodelim=40000" > > En espérant que ça soit utile et, peut-être, le début d'un échange fructueux. > > Bien cordialement, > Sonia
> -- > ======================================= > Sonia Cafieri > ENAC - Ecole Nationale de l'Aviation Civile > Laboratoire MAIAA > 7, Avenue Edouard Belin > F-31055 Toulouse France > Tel : +33 (0)5 62 25 95 11 > Email : sonia.cafieri@enac.fr > http://www.recherche.enac.fr/~cafieri/

IT deals with the Oracle Java versions on Sun machines.
https://itsas.raleigh.ibm.com/itsas/
IBM:
$ /opt/java_ibm5.0u36sdk_32bit/bin/java -version java version "1.5.0_36" Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (IBM build 1.5.0_36-b32 20120809 solaris i386 (SR14)) Java HotSpot(TM) Server VM (build 1.5.0_36-b32, mixed mode) IBM Java ORB build orb50-20120611 XML build XSLT4J Java 2.7.23 XML build IBM JAXP 1.3.12 XML build XML4J 4.4.23
$ /opt/java_ibm5.0u36sdk_64bit/bin/java -version
Oracle:
$ ls -l /usr/jdk total 10 drwxr-xr-x 4 root bin 4 Sep 28 17:59 instances lrwxrwxrwx 1 root other 7 Oct 8 12:35 j2sdk1.4.2_38 -> ../j2se lrwxrwxrwx 1 root other 18 Oct 8 12:26 jdk1.5.0_36 -> instances/jdk1.5.0 lrwxrwxrwx 1 root other 18 Oct 8 12:17 jdk1.6.0_35 -> instances/jdk1.6.0 lrwxrwxrwx 1 root other 11 Oct 8 12:17 latest -> jdk1.6.0_35 drwxr-xr-x 8 root bin 8 Sep 28 18:01 packages

Team: they should all have OSS training
item.note:
Devs should follow OSPG training on: https://w3.tap.ibm.com/w3ki07/display/OSSCProcess/OSPG
Results can be checked on: https://ltc.linux.ibm.com/ospg/bluegroups.php

item.title: Check the Windows machines use an IBM JDK
Change password
item.note: Thinkpad + Desktop IBM Intranet (https://w3.ibm.com/profile/update/password/en-us/index.html) Notes (File -> Security -> User Security IBM VPN (disconnect, click on the 'down' arrow in the Connect button, change -- No need to 'disremember' the password) https://ittools.francelab.fr.ibm.com/passwdmgt/ (enter xavier.nodet@fr.ibm.com with the new password), then 'Changing your AD password', and 'Changing your NIS password' login on mvfs.svl.ibm.com as 'nodet', run '/usr/IBMi/tools/bin/ldappasswd -e90', 'source /ilog/cplex/software/cpxtools.sh' and 'rtclogin' (type the new password) login on svcplexdev13.svl.ibm.com as 'nodet', run 'passwd' login on p6tpm09c.hursley.ibm.com as 'nodetxav' and run 'passwd' https://huritim.hursley.ibm.com/itim/self/Home.do (beware, only letters and digits!) http://accounts.usca.ibm.com/accounts/ to change ISLABS account

item.title: Change cplexadmin password
item.note:
French unix machines first because they seem the most restrictive (must have two non-alpha, non-digit chars, not only one)
French unix + Windows machines: https://ittools.ilogfr-bso.fr.ibm.com/passwdmgt/ mvfs.svl.ibm.com: run '/usr/IBMi/tools/bin/ldappasswd -e90' Hursley: https://huritim.hursley.ibm.com/itim/self/Home.do ('Current Intranet password' really means my (Xavier Nodet's) password) SVL Windows machines: log onto svts01 and change the password p6tpm09c.hursley.ibm.com: log, then use 'passwd' svcplexdev13: log on, then 'passwd' When changing password on mvfs, no need for an 'rtclogin' (it doesn't work, anyway: can't log onto the Jazz server): cplexadmin is not allowed to push anyway...

item.title: Anniversaire Lucie
item.note: Prendre une journée Exfoliant Origin's Invitation restau (Le figuier du Saint Esprit ?) Sac à main
